intro: Amphione tiliifolia, commonly known as the silky tiliifolia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its soft, hairy leaves and showy, pink or purple flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and conservation efforts.
